Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function and constraints are linear.
Solvability: Polynomial time via simplex or interior-point methods.

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimization with integer decision variables, often NP-hard.
Solvability: Exact methods like branch-and-bound or heuristics.
Example: Scheduling staff shifts with fixed slots.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Example: Portfolio optimization with nonlinear risk-return tradeoff.

Name: Mixed-Integer Programming
Description: Combines integer and continuous variables in constraints/objective.
Example: Supply chain design with discrete plant locations.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Optimization where the objective and feasible set are convex.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Breaks problems into overlapping subproblems solved recursively.
Example: Shortest path in a weighted graph.

Name: Stochastic Programming
Description: Optimization under uncertainty with probabilistic constraints.
Example: Energy grid management under demand uncertainty.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimization over discrete structures like graphs, sets, sequences.

Name: Multi-Objective Optimization
Example: Balancing cost and performance in engineering design.

Name: Constraint Programming
Description: Optimization with constraints expressed in a constraint satisfaction framework.
